intro: Christella × acuminatoides, commonly known as the hybrid Christmas rose, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with rhizomatous roots that help it survive in rocky or well-drained soils. Its ornamental value lies in its early blooming habit and ability to thrive in shaded, woodland environments.
